full_product_name.product_name: rh-sso7-keycloak-0:9.0.10-1.redhat_00001.1.el7sso as a component of Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4 for RHEL 7 Server

branch.name: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4 for RHEL 7 Server

full_product_name.product_name: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4 for RHEL 7 Server

notes.note: keycloak: Account REST API can update user metadata attributes

reference.description: bz#1905089: CVE-2020-27826 keycloak: Account REST API can update user metadata attributes

remediation.description:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata relevant to your system have been applied.
For details on how to apply this update, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.description: This issue was discovered by Marek Posolda (Red Hat).

note: New Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.4 packages are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.
This release of Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.4 on RHEL 7 serves as a replacement for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.3, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes document linked to in the References.
Security Fix(es):
* keycloak: Account REST API can update user metadata attributes (CVE-2020-27826)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
